results.title: Ecology
results.creator_credit: Mal Tennant, Julie Clarke and Sandra Cleary
results.brief_description: Ecology is a far-sighted and exhilirating testament from a diverse but growing community of academics, scientists, futuristic thinkers and philosophers from around the world that points the way to an enlightened tomorrow. Rated: G

results.title: Eat a bowl of tea
results.creator_credit: Wayne Wong, Tom Sternberg, American Playhouse Theatrical Films and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Set between 1949-1951, Wayne Wong’s Capra-style comedy centers on an arranged marriage in New York’s Chinatown. The marriage is a romantic and emotional success until it comes under well-intended but intolerable pressures from the Chinese-American community. The film asks how a young couple can cope when there are few role models at hand and they are isolated from their parents. It also shows the drastic effect of the endless pressure from family and friends to bear children. The tone however remains light, and while broaching serious political and social issues, the film uses laughter rather than anger to highlight these. English and Cantonese dialogue with some English subtitles.

results.title: Eclair. Episode 04
results.creator_credit: Alma Gray, David Ash, Pat McLagan and ILEA
results.brief_description: The series “Eclair” features Ted, a rather confused and naive Englishman and a pair of mischievous French adolescent twins. The theme of this films is: “School life - the school day and the subjects on the timetable” through conversing and expressing likes and dislikes of various school subjects

results.title: Easy rider [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hopper, Peter Fonda and Columbia
results.brief_description: This is a digitally remastered 30th anniversary collector’s edition of the modern classic tale of two carefree young men who take a leisurely motorcycle ride across the southern United States after concluding a drug deal to pay expenses. With an exceptional performance by Jack Nicholson as an alcoholic lawyer, the cast also includes Peter Fonda and Dennis Hopper.

results.title: Animated stories
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
These animated stories from the television series “Lift Off”, written by leading Australian children’s authors such as Paul Jennings and Jean Hepworth, open up a new world of fantasy and imagination for children. This collection of ten short films displays the work of some of Australia’s most talented animators. The titles included are “Snookle”, “Hunting the not fair”, “Rough, rough”, “Jason becomes a giant”, “Molly’s sock”, “Ice flowers”, “Murgatroyd’s garden”, “Dancing pants”, “Fair swap” and “Burping baby”.

results.title: Mr. Fish and Lotis
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
This video features the character’s Mr. Fish (the security guard) and Lotis (a lift) in a combination of songs and stories. Lotis is no ordinary lift - she can travel with children to any place and any time. Mr. Fish is in a glass booth that makes him look like he is in an enormous fish bowl surrounded by a bank of TV monitors.

results.title: Echoes that remain
results.creator_credit: Arnold Schwartzman, Marvin Hier and Simon Wiesenthal Centre
results.brief_description: Martin Landau and Miriam Margolyes narrate “Echoes that remain” a moving documentary about the people of the shtetl and their lives before the Holocaust. Director Arnold Schwartzman combines past and present as archival footage is intercut with live action sequences filmed at the sites of former Jewish communities in Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Poland and Romania. The production crew’s research and admiration for the subject matter is evident and echoes of the film will remain with the viewer. Presented by one of America’s leading Jewish cultural institutions, the Simon Wiesenthal Centre. Music performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: Imagine, EC and me
results.creator_credit: Brendan Maher, John Taylor, Ray Boseley, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones, Sandra Alexander, Susie Campbell, ABC-TV (Australia) and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
The Lift Off kids return in a brand new series with lots of fun and two new friends, Raph and Mario Ponti. We also meet Mr. Fish as a child in this delightful combination of songs and episodes. “Brand new”: EC and the Lift Off kids meet Raplh and Mario Ponti who arrive in time for Mario to help Nipper learn to rollerblade. “Under pressure”: Kim would do anything to be Princess Joanna in the school play, even trade EC! “Out of this world”: Aku’s goldfish Herbie is gone but not forgotten when he returns to haunt the plumbing! “Imagine EC and me”: Mr. Fish learns what it is like to be a child again with a little help from EC.

results.title: EC and the lift-off kids
results.creator_credit: Amanda Smith, Steve Joddrell, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Three more adventures with EC. In “Scratch it” Nipper wants to be a grown up so he can do fun things with EC and his friends like camping, so the children decide to camp in the backyard. In “All together now” Nipper hurts his knee while playing in a vacant block. In “For sale” the children have turned an old warehouse into their own theatre, but find out that the warehouse is going to be sold.
